column4: were do i get the depostitorys for xine and xxms and etc  like suse has
so what're you actually trying to do, aside from offend the channel?
there's something over 15,000 files in the full Ubuntu archives, it's not too restrictive... :P
totem-xine + libdvdread3 plays DVDs fine, it's by far the easiest way to do it...
that's not the most exact list... but enable the Universe/Multiverse repos and update, and you should be OK...
what app are you looking for?
do you have the Universe repo enabled in Ubuntu?
which apps, then? (I've never run Suse, got no idea what's available for that distro...)
you really do need to be less vague than "anything"...
look for .deb files, if you're certain that what you want isn't in Ubuntu's repos...
restricted is enabled by default, multiverse & universe are the two that aren't. Please read the URL I gave you.
after you update your repository listings, the stuff in them is visible in synaptic just like everything else
